description: The XM250 is the US military designation for the SIG-LMG a 6.8×51mm, gas-operated, reciprocating barrel, belt-fed, light machine gun designed by SIG Sauer for the U.S. Army's Next Generation Squad Weapon Program in 2022 to replace the M249 light machine gun. The XM250 features a free-floating reinforced M-LOK handguard for direct accessory attachment onto the negative space hollow slot mounting points.

The XM5 is the U.S. Army variant of the SIG MCX Spear, a 6.8×51mm, gas-operated, magazine-fed, assault rifle designed by SIG Sauer for the Next Generation Squad Weapon Program in 2022 to replace the M4 carbine. The XM5 features a free-floating reinforced M-LOK handguard for direct accessory attachment onto the negative space hollow slot mounting points.
